adverb &amp; adjective.description: Situated diagonally opposite someone or something.
examples: apartments in the renovated building cater-cornered from the church
parking is available cater-corner to the restaurant
there were two young women across from me in cater-corner seats

origin: Mid 19th century: from dialect cater diagonally, from cater denoting the four on dice, from French quatre four, from Latin quattuor.
